message_1: Suppose the elliptic curve used in a cryptography system is defined by the equation y^2 â‰¡ x^3 + 5x + 7 (mod 23). If the generator point is G = (9, 7), and the public key is P = [11]G, where [11] denotes adding G to itself 11 times, what is the private key?
message_2: In elliptic curve cryptography, the private key is the scalar value used to multiply the generator point to obtain the public key. In this case, the private key is 11, since P = [11]G.
